The Origins of States
item.description:
What led to the emergence of states? What explains their timing and geography? Did peasants embrace state-protection or were they forced to stay put? Theories include: Cereals - which could be hoarded and used to feed armies Collective defence against nomads on the steppe‚Ä¶

item.title: Freedom Conservatism: A Statement of Principles
item.description:
On September 11, 1960, a group of young conservatives gathered in the home of William F. Buckley, Jr., in Sharon, Connecticut. For decades, the timeless ideals embodied in the document they produced animated the American conservative movement. Today‚Äôs public policy challenges are different than the ones faced by the Sharon Statement signatories in 1960. ‚Ä¶

URL: https://www.freedomconservatism.org/p/freedom-conservatism-a-statement?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: Links to Consider, 8/6
